title: Malin Andersson shares heartbreaking post to highlight Baby Loss Awareness Week
text:

Malin Andersson has paid tribute to her late baby daughter Consy who tragically died in January just weeks after being born.

The 26-year-old former Love Island star and her then-boyfriend Tom Kemp were left devastated when their daughter passed away after being born prematurely at the start of the year.

Taking to Instagram on Monday, Malin took time to reflect on the daughter that she lost to help raise awareness of the upcoming Baby Loss Awareness week which is happening this month.

Malin shared a photograph of her tiny baby from when she was in hospital, with a medical devices helping her breathe in the days before her death.

(Image: missmalinsara /Instagram)

“I think about you and how you would be like every day. I love you baby girl. My heart hurts,” Malin wrote as she shared the image with followers.

“Baby loss awareness week 9th-15th October. Let’s raise awareness,” she added, alongside a red heart emoji and linking to the Baby Loss Awareness Week Instagram account.

The charity’s website states: “Each year the 9th-15th October is Baby Loss Awareness Week and throughout the week bereaved parents, family members and friends can commemorate the all-too-brief lives of their babies, knowing that thousands of other families elsewhere in the world will be doing the same.”

(Image: missmalinsara /Instagram)

The website adds: “The week also provides a crucial opportunity for people to talk openly about the subject of and raise awareness of baby loss.”

Blue and pink ribbon badges are available to buy from the website for £1 with funds benefiting Sands – the stillbirth and neonatal death charity.

Malin’s daughter Consy was born via emergency caesarean on December 23 last year after doctors discovered she had a heart defect – with the baby girl being born at 33 weeks.

(Image: Brett D. Cove / SplashNews.com)

After sharing her photo of her daughter, Malin was overwhelmed with messages of encouragement and support.

“Thank you everyone for such lovely and amazing words,” she wrote on her Instagram.

“It takes courage for you all to share your stories with time also. I am blessed to have amazing followers,” she added.

* Samaritans (116 123) operates a 24-hour service available every day of the year. If you prefer to write down how you’re feeling, or if you’re worried about being overheard on the phone, you can email Samaritans at jo@samaritans.org
description: The Love Island star tragically lost her first child at the start of the year following an earlier than planned birth
